title: Women of the Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court is the highest court in the United States, and only the most respected and distinguished judges can serve on it. This book will introduce the reader to the four women who have become judges on the Supreme Court and the hard work it took for each one to get there. Meet and get to know Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Sandra Day O'Connor, Sonia Sotomayor, and Elena Kagan.
highFrequencyWords: amendment, case, Constitution, discrimination, justices, Latina, majority, nominated, rights
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Vowel Digraphs                : Identify and discriminate the different digraphs for the long /e/ sound
awareness: Proper Nouns                : Identify and understand the use of proper nouns
phonics: Suffixes : Apply the suffix -ed to change the tense of a verb
grammar:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
